column4: you can boot 9.10 from grub1 and 8.04 from grub2 if need be. Do you know what went wrong with your 8.04 install?
- I'm not sure at what point it went bad, bit it said there were errors on the DVD.
Do you have a good live install cd for 9.10?
if you can boot the 8.04 livecd, you can do a grub restore. Let me find a link for you...
I can burn one and come back when I have it if necessary.
ok, i tried following one, and i got to the step that said to do a find, and i got an error, the instructions said nothing about what to do on error
erm, if your 9.10 release uses ext4 (the default) you won't be able to see if from 8.04 and you'll need to do the grub restore using the 9.10 livecd...
All my partitions are NTFS or Ext3 (or swap)
ok, can you open a terminal and run 'sudo fdisk -l' (that's lower case L) and paste the output to http://ubuntu.pastebin.com
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/FyXUHRiV
agreed, I see ntfs on /dev/sda1 (is that a windows install?) and ext3 on /dev/sda2, 5 and 6.
yep... sda1 = WinXP... sda2=9.10 (/)... sda3=swap... sda5=(/home for both 9.10 and 8.04)... sda6=failed 8.04 (/) install
because your 8.04 is in an unknown state, I think you'd better boot 9.10 and do a grub recovery from there....
because there's no guarantee your 8.04 is bootable if the install went wrong...
I don't need the 8.04 at all anymore, we can just delete it.
just ignore it for now, nothing to be gained by going around deleting partitions at this point. You need to boot 9.10 live cd
Don't currently have a 9.10 livecd, will burn one and come back (I have another computer).
ok, in case I'm not here, https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Grub2#Recover%20Grub%202%20via%20LiveCD
ok, thanks :)
best of luck :-)
glad to hear it. You can install 9.04 over the failed 8.04 install by choosing manual partition during install. Best of luck...
